sen.j: 田中 久重（たなか ひさしげ、寛政11年9月18日 (旧暦)（1799年10月16日） - 明治14年（1881年）1月11日）は、江戸時代から明治にかけて「東洋のトーマス・エジソン」「からくり儀右衛門」と呼ばれ活躍した発明家。
sen.e: Hisashige TANAKA (October 16, 1799 - January 11, 1881) was an inventor nicknamed 'Thomas EDISON of the East' and "Karakuri (gimmick) Giemon", who lived from the Edo Period through the Meiji Period.
Hisashige TANAKA (October 16, 1799 - November 7, 1881) was an inventor nicknamed 'Thomas EDISON of the East' and "Karakuri (gimmick) Giemon", who lived from the Edo Period through the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: ・「January 11, 1881」 → 『November 7, 1881』に修正しました。（理由：「January 11（＝１月11日）」は、記述されている通り明治14年の月日であり、西暦1881年では、下記のサイト上で、『November 7』と記載がありました。）・誕生日がTOSHIBAのサイト http://kagakukan.toshiba.co.jp/manabu/history/spirit/en/roots/index.htmlと、違います。
sen.e: Hisashige TANAKA (October 16, 1799 - January 11, 1881) was an inventor nicknamed 'Thomas EDISON of the East' and "Karakuri (gimmick) Giemon," who lived from the Edo Period through the Meiji Period.
sen.cmt: 原文通りの日付に戻しました。コンマの位置を変更しました。

sen.j: 筑後国久留米（現在の福岡県久留米市）生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
He was born in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
He was born in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).

sen.j: 久重が創設した田中製造所は後年、東芝となる。
sen.e: "TANAKA Seizo jo" (The TANAKA manufacturing factory) which he started grew to be TOSHIBA CORPORATION later.
TANAKA Seizo sho (TANAKA manufacturing factory) which he founded was called TOSHIBA CORPORATION later.
sen.cmt: ・「TANAKA Seizo jo」 → 『TANAKA Seizo sho』に修正しました。・「(The TANAKA manufacturing factory)」 → 『(TANAKA manufacturing factory)』と、「The」を削除し変更しました。 ・「which he started grew to be」 → 『which he founded was called』に、修正しました。
sen.e: TANAKA Seizo sho (TANAKA manufacturing factory) which he founded was called TOSHIBA CORPORATION later.

sen.j: 寛政11年（1799年）9月18日、筑後国久留米（現在の福岡県久留米市）の鼈甲細工師・田中弥右衛門の長男としての生まれ。
sen.e: In September 18, 1799, Hisashige was born as the first son to Yaemon TANAKA, a craftsman of tortoise shell in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
In 1799, Hisashige was born as the first son of Yaemon TANAKA, a craftsman of tortoise shell in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ・「In September 18, 1799,」 → 『In 1799,』に修正しました。（「September 18（＝9月18日）,」は、記述のとおり「寛政11年」の月日であり、西暦『1799』年とは一致していません。）・「the first son to」 → 『the first son of』に、修正しました。
sen.e: On October 16, 1799, Hisashige was born as the first son of Yaemon TANAKA, a craftsman of tortoise shell in Kurume, Chikugo Province (present-day Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 寛政11年（1799年）9月18日→1799年10月16日（グレゴリオ歴）の日付を補足しました。（最初の日付に合わせました）

sen.j: 幼名は「儀右衛門」である。
sen.e: His childhood name was Giemon.
His childhood name was Giemon.
His childhood name was Giemon.

sen.j: 幼い頃から才能を発揮し、久留米・五穀神社（久留米市通外町）の祭礼では、当時流行していたからくり人形の新しい仕掛けを次々と考案して大評判を呼ぶ。
sen.e: While young, Hisashige already exercised his talent in invention, and showed newly devised gizmos designed for a popular string puppet one after another in the rites and festivals of Gokoku-jinja Shrine of Kurume (Torihoka Town, Kurume City), which earned him enormous popularity.

While young, Hisashige already exercised his talent in invention, and showed new devices of popular string puppets one after another in festivals of Gokoku-jinja Shrine in Kurume (Torihoka Town, Kurume City), which earned him enormous popularity.
sen.cmt: ・「newly devised gizmos designed for a popular string puppet」 → 『new devices of popular string puppets』に変更しました。・「in the rites and festivals of Gokoku-jinja Shrine of Kurume」 → 『in festivals of Gokoku-jinja Shrine in Kurume』に変更しました。
sen.e: While young, Hisashige already exercised his talent in invention, and showed new devices of popular string puppets one after another in festivals of Gokoku-jinja Shrine in Kurume (Torihoka Town, Kurume City), which earned him enormous popularity.

sen.j: この間九州各地や大阪・京都・江戸でも興行を行い、その成功により全国にその名を知られる。
sen.e: He also succeeded in demonstrating his inventions in various places of the Kyushu region, Osaka, Kyoto and Edo, and became well known across the country.
He also succeeded in demonstrating his inventions in various places of the Kyushu region, Osaka, Kyoto and Edo, and became well known across the country.
He also succeeded in demonstrating his inventions in various places of the Kyushu region, Osaka, Kyoto and Edo, and became well known across the country.

tit.e: Time in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area)
Time in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area)
Time in Kamigata (Kyoto and Osaka area)

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）には大阪の伏見（現在の大阪市中央区 (大阪市)伏見町）に移り、懐中燭台、無尽灯（圧縮空気により灯油を補給する灯明）などを考案し「からくり儀右衛門」と呼ばれ人気を博する。
sen.e: In 1834, Hisashige moved to Fushimi, Osaka (present-day Fushimi-cho, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) where he constructed various devices such as a portable candle stand and an automatically-refueling lamp that used compressed air to replenish oils, for which he won a nickname, 'Karakuri Giemon' and also popularity among people.

In 1834, Hisashige moved to Fushimi, Osaka (present-day Fushimi-cho, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) where he constructed various devices such as a portable candle stand and an automatic-refueling lamp (that used compressed air to replenish oils), for which he won a nickname, 'Karakuri Giemon' and also popularity among people.
sen.cmt: ・「an automatically-refueling lamp」 → 『an automatic-refueling lamp』に修正しました。・「that used compressed air to replenish oils,」 → 『 (that used compressed air to replenish oils),』と、（ ） を入れました。
sen.e: In 1834, Hisashige moved to Fushimi, Osaka (present-day Fushimi-cho, Chuo Ward, Osaka City) where he constructed various devices such as a portable candle stand and an automatic-refueling lamp (that used compressed air to replenish oils), for which he won a nickname, 'Karakuri Giemon' and also popularity among people.

sen.j: その後京都へ移り、天文学や蘭学などの西洋の文化技術を学ぶ。
sen.e: He then moved to Kyoto to learn western culture and technologies including astronomy and other western studies.
He then moved to Kyoto to learn western culture and technology including astronomy and sciences.
sen.cmt: ・「western culture and technologies」 → 『western culture and technology』と、単数形で統一しました。・「other western studies」 → 『sciences』 に変更しました。
sen.e: He then moved to Kyoto to learn western culture and technology including astronomy and sciences.

sen.j: 嘉永4年（1851年）には現在国の重要文化財に指定されている「万年自鳴鐘」を完成させた。
sen.e: In 1851, Hisashige completed his masterpiece, 'Mannen Jimeisho' (a mechanical stand clock), which is now designated as a national important cultural property.
In 1851, Hisashige completed his masterpiece, 'Mannen Jimeisho' (a mechanical stand clock), which is now designated as a national important cultural property.
In 1851, Hisashige completed his masterpiece, 'Mannen Jimeisho' (a mechanical stand clock), which is now designated as a national important cultural property.

sen.j: 「万年時計」として知られるこの時計は2004年（平成16年）に東芝、セイコーホールディングスなどの研究者によって分析・復元され、レプリカが2005年（平成17年）の2005年日本国際博覧会で展示された。
sen.e: The clock which is commonly called 'Mannen Dokei' was overhauled once for analysis and restored by researchers of TOSHIBA and SEIKO Holdings, and its replica was exhibited in The 2005 World Exposition in 2005.

The clock which is commonly called 'Mannen Dokei' was overhauled once for analysis and restored by researchers of TOSHIBA and SEIKO Holdings, and its replica was exhibited in The 2005 World Exposition in 2005.

The clock which is commonly called 'Mannen Dokei' was overhauled once for analysis and restored by researchers of TOSHIBA and SEIKO Holdings, and its replica was exhibited in The 2005 World Exposition in 2005.

sen.j: この復元作業には100人の技術者が携わり、最新の機材を投入したが、解析に時間がかかった。
sen.e: Although a hundred technicians and state-of-the art materials were mobilized for the analysis and restoration work, the analysis of the clock took more time than expected.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although a hundred technicians and state-of-the art materials were mobilized for the analysis and restoration work, the analysis of the clock took more time than expected.
Although a hundred technicians and state-of-the art materials were mobilized for the analysis and restoration work, the analysis of the clock took more time than expected.

sen.j: そのため、愛・地球博の開催日までに、動力の発条（ぜんまいばね）に使われている分厚い真鍮板を調達できなかった事などを理由に、展示されたレプリカは完璧な復元には至らなかった（開催中はステンレス製のぜんまいが代用された）。
sen.e: Therefore, a thick brass board which was used in a spiral spring was not ready in time for the opening day of the Exposition of Global Harmony (during the Expo, a stainless-steel spring was substituted for the brass one), and the replica exhibited could not be in perfect restored shape.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, a thick brass board which was used in a spiral spring was not ready in time for the opening day of the Exposition of Global Harmony (during the Expo, a stainless-steel spring was substituted for the brass one), and the replica exhibited could not be in perfect restored shape.

Therefore, a thick brass board which was used in a spiral spring was not ready in time for the opening day of the Exposition of Global Harmony (during the Expo, a stainless-steel spring was substituted for the brass one), and the replica exhibited could not be in perfect restored shape.

sen.j: 現在「万年自鳴鐘」の原品は国立科学博物館に寄託され、2007年（平成19年）には機械遺産に認定された。
sen.e: Now, the original 'Mannen Jimeisho' was in the hands of The National Museum of Nature and Science and designated as a Mechanical Engineering Heritage in 2007.
Now, the original 'Mannen Jimeisho' was in the hands of the National Museum of Nature and Science and designated as a Mechanical Engineering Heritage in 2007.
sen.cmt: 「The National Museum」 → 『the National Museum』に変更しました。
sen.e: Now, the original 'Mannen Jimeisho' was in the hands of the National Museum of Nature and Science and designated as a Mechanical Engineering Heritage in 2007.

sen.j: 嘉永6年（1853年）、佐野常民の薦めで蘭学狂いと言われた鍋島直正が治める肥前国佐賀藩の精煉方に着任し、国産では日本初の蒸気機関車及び蒸気船の模型を製造。
sen.e: In 1853, with the recommendation of Tsunetami SANO, Hisashige assumed the post of 'Seiren gata' (a research and development section of advanced technologies) in the Saga Domain, Hizen Province which area was ruled by a Western-studies geek, Naomasa NABESHIMA, where Hisashige succeeded in building Japan's first models of a steam locomotive and a steamboat.

In 1853, with the recommendation of Tsunetami SANO, Hisashige assumed the post of 'Seiren gata' (a research and development section of advanced technologies) in the Saga Domain, Hizen Province which area was ruled by a Western-studies geek, Naomasa NABESHIMA, where Hisashige succeeded in building Japan's first models of a steam locomotive and a steamboat.

In 1853, with the recommendation of Tsunetami SANO, Hisashige assumed the post of 'Seiren gata' (a research and development section of advanced technologies) in the Saga Domain, Hizen Province which area was ruled by a Western-studies geek, Naomasa NABESHIMA, where Hisashige succeeded in building Japan's first models of a steam locomotive and a steamboat.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年） 佐賀藩の反射炉で初の国産アームストロング砲を完成させる。
sen.e: In 1863, he completed the first domestic Armstrong Cannon by using a reverberatory furnace installed in the Saga Domain.
In 1863, he completed the first domestic Armstrong Cannon by using a reverberatory furnace installed in the Saga Domain.
In 1863, he completed the first domestic Armstrong Cannon by using a reverberatory furnace installed in the Saga Domain.

sen.j: 佐賀藩の興隆に尽くす。
sen.e: Hisashige committed himself to the rise of the Saga Domain.
Hisashige committed himself to the rise of the Saga Domain.
Hisashige committed himself to the rise of the Saga Domain.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）には久留米藩に帰り、藩の軍艦購入や銃砲の鋳造に携わり、殖産興業等にも貢献した。
sen.e: In 1864, he returned to his native Kurume Domain and got involved in the process of purchasing warships and creating guns and cannons for the Domain, contributing to the development of the military industry.

In 1864, he returned to his native Kurume Domain and got involved in the process of purchasing warships and creating guns and cannons for the Domain, contributing to the development of the military industry.

In 1864, he returned to his native Kurume Domain and got involved in the process of purchasing warships and creating guns and cannons for the Domain, contributing to the development of the military industry.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）に上京。
sen.e: In 1873, Hisashige moved to Tokyo.
In 1873, Hisashige moved to Tokyo.
In 1873, Hisashige moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 明治8年（1875年）に東京・銀座に電信機関係の製作所・田中製造所を設立。
sen.e: In 1875, he started 'TANAKA Seizo jo' (the TANAKA manufacturing factory), a telegraph machine maker, in Ginza, Tokyo.
In 1875, he started 'TANAKA Seizo sho' (the TANAKA manufacturing factory), a telegraph machine maker, in Ginza, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 「TANAKA Seizo jo」 → 『TANAKA Seizo sho』に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1875, he started 'TANAKA Seizo sho' (the TANAKA manufacturing factory), a telegraph machine maker, in Ginza, Tokyo.

sen.j: 明治14年1月11日、発明に全てを捧げた82年の生涯に幕を閉じた。
sen.e: On January 11, 1881, Hisashige died at the age of 82, dedicating all his life to invention.
On November 7, 1881, Hisashige died at the age of 82, dedicating all his life to invention.
sen.cmt: 「On January 11, 1881」 → 『On November 7, 1881』に変更しました。http://kagakukan.toshiba.co.jp/manabu/history/spirit/en/roots/index.htmlのご参照願います。
sen.e: On January 11, 1881, Hisashige died at the age of 82, dedicating all his life to invention.
sen.cmt: こちらも、原文どおりの日付に戻しました。

sen.j: 久重亡き後、養子の田中久重 (2代目)が会社を受け継ぎ、これが現在の東芝の基礎となった。
sen.e: After his death, his adopted child, Hisashige TANAKA, succeeded the factory and built the foundation of the current TOSHIBA.
After his death, his adopted child, Hisashige TANAKA, succeeded to the factory and built the foundation of the current TOSHIBA.
sen.cmt: 「succeeded the factory」 → 『succeeded to the factory』に修正しました。
sen.e: After his death, his adopted child, Hisashige TANAKA, succeeded to the factory and built the foundation of the current TOSHIBA.

sen.j: 久重の言葉
sen.e: Lessons from Hisashige
Lessons from Hisashige
Lessons from Hisashige

sen.j: 高い志を持ち、創造のためには自らに妥協を許さなかった久重は以下の言葉を残している。
sen.e: Hisashige, who had high motives and did not concede for his invention, left a following lesson.
Hisashige, who had high motives and did not concede for his invention, left a following lesson.
Hisashige, who had high motives and did not concede for his invention, left a following lesson.

sen.j: 「知識は失敗より学ぶ。
sen.e: "Knowledge can be obtained through failures.
"Knowledge can be obtained through failures.
"Knowledge can be obtained through failures.

sen.j: 事を成就するには、志があり、忍耐があり、勇気があり、失敗があり、その後に、成就があるのである」
sen.e: To fulfill one's dream, there need to be a motive, perseverance, courage and failure, and a success never comes before these elements.'
To fulfill one's dream, there need to be a motive, perseverance, courage and failure, and a success never comes before these elements.'
To fulfill one's dream, there need to be a motive, perseverance, courage and failure, and a success never comes before these elements.'
